question.text: Which one of the following cannot be explained by the law of dominance?

options.text: The discrete unit controlling a particular character is called as factor
In a pair of factors, one unit factor is dominant, while other is recessive
Alleles do not show any blending and both the characters recover as such in F<sub>2</sub> generation

solution.text: According to Mendel's law of dominance, out of two contrasting allelomorphic factors, only one expresses itself in an individual. The factor that expresses itself is called dominant while the other which has not shown its effect only in the homozygous individual is termed as recessive. The option alleles do not show any blending and both the characters recover as such in F2 generation in the given question cannot be explained on the basis of the law of dominance. It can only be explained on the basis of Mendel's law of purity of gametes.
